block.p: A Look at Food and Values

Millennial Stews, a four-day conference with more than 75 sessions about food, agriculture and society organized by two scholarly groups, the Association for the Study of Food and Society, and the Agriculture, Food and Human Values Society, will be held June 1 through 4 at New York University's Department of Food and Nutrition Studies, 35 West Fourth Street. Fee: $165 for four days or $60 a day ($50 for students). For a schedule: (212) 998-5580.
A Look at Food and Values

Millennial Stews, a four-day conference with more than 75 sessions about food, agriculture and society organized by two scholarly groups, the Association for the Study of Food and Society, and the Agriculture, Food and Human Values Society, will be held June 1 through 4 at New York University's Department of Food and Nutrition Studies, 35 West Fourth Street. Fee: $165 for four days or $60 a day ($50 for students). For a schedule: (212) 998-5580.

A panel discussion about food in Israel will be held at Peter Kump's New York Cooking School, 50 West 23rd Street, on June 4, from 6 to 8:30 p.m. Six Israeli chefs will participate in the event, which benefits the Schneider Children's Medical Center of Israel in Petach Tikva. Tickets are $80; (212) 847-0770.

The summer session of the Windows on the World Wine School, now in its 20th season, will start June 7 and meet on Wednesdays through July 26, from 6:30 to 8:30 p.m. at Windows on the World, 1 World Trade Center. Tuition is $795. Information: (914) 255-1456.

Restaurant Week's $20 lunches will be available at 130 places from June 19 through 23. A list is available in person or by mail (with a stamped self-addressed envelope) from NYC & Company, 810 Seventh Avenue (53rd Street), New York 10019.
